alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 06 at 10:56AM CST until March 07 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Memphis TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion affecting Obion, Gibson and Dyer Counties. For the Obion River...including Martin, Obion, Bogota...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Farmland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 34.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Monday was 34.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 34.4 feet on 01/17/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1200 AM CST.
